info.description:
This is the documentation of the Gotify REST-API.

# Authentication
In Gotify there are two token types:
__clientToken__: a client is something that receives message and manages stuff like creating new tokens or delete messages. (f.ex this token should be used for an android app)
__appToken__: an application is something that sends messages (f.ex. this token should be used for a shell script)

The token can be transmitted in a header named `X-Gotify-Key`, in a query parameter named `token` or
through a header named `Authorization` with the value prefixed with `Bearer` (Ex. `Bearer randomtoken`).
There is also the possibility to authenticate through basic auth, this should only be used for creating a clientToken.

\---

Found a bug or have some questions? [Create an issue on GitHub](https://github.com/gotify/server/issues)
info.title: Gotify REST-API.

post.summary: Upload an image for an application.

get.summary: Return all messages from a specific application.

parameters.description: the maximal amount of messages to return
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: return all messages with an ID less than this value
parameters.name: since

post.summary: Update the password of the current user.

parameters.description: the maximal amount of messages to return
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: return all messages with an ID less than this value
parameters.name: since

post.description: __NOTE__: This API ONLY accepts an application token as authentication.

delete.summary: Deletes a message with an id.

get.summary: Get YAML configuration for Configurer plugin.

post.summary: Update YAML configuration for Configurer plugin.

get.summary: Get display info for a Displayer plugin.

post.description:
With enabled registration: non admin users can be created without authentication.
With disabled registrations: users can only be created by admin users.

Application.description: The Application holds information about an app which can send notifications.
Application.title: Application Model

internal.description: Whether the application is an internal application. Internal applications should not be deleted.

name.description: The application name. This is how the application should be displayed to the user.

token.description: The application token. Can be used as `appToken`. See Authentication.

ApplicationParams.description: Params allowed to create or update Applications
ApplicationParams.title: Application Params Model

name.description: The application name. This is how the application should be displayed to the user.

Client.description: The Client holds information about a device which can receive notifications (and other stuff).
Client.title: Client Model

name.description: The client name. This is how the client should be displayed to the user.

token.description: The client token. Can be used as `clientToken`. See Authentication.

ClientParams.description: Params allowed to create or update Clients
ClientParams.title: Client Params Model

admin.description: If the user is an administrator.

Error.description: The Error contains error relevant information.
Error.title: Error Model

errorDescription.example: you need to provide a valid access token or user credentials to access this api

Health.description: Health represents how healthy the application is.
Health.title: Health Model

database.description: The health of the database connection.

health.description: The health of the overall application.

Message.description: The MessageExternal holds information about a message which was sent by an Application.
Message.title: MessageExternal Model

appid.description: The application id that send this message.

date.description: The date the message was created.

extras.description:
The extra data sent along the message.

The extra fields are stored in a key-value scheme. Only accepted in CreateMessage requests with application/json content-type.

The keys should be in the following format: <top-namespace>::[<sub-namespace>::]<action>

These namespaces are reserved and might be used in the official clients: gotify android ios web server client. Do not use them for other purposes.

message.description: The message. Markdown (excluding html) is allowed.

PagedMessages.description: Wrapper for the paging and the messages
PagedMessages.title: PagedMessages Model

Paging.description: The Paging holds information about the limit and making requests to the next page.
Paging.title: Paging Model

limit.description: The limit of the messages for the current request.

next.description: The request url for the next page. Empty/Null when no next page is available.

since.description: The ID of the last message returned in the current request. Use this as alternative to the next link.

size.description: The amount of messages that got returned in the current request.

PluginConf.description: Holds information about a plugin instance for one user.
PluginConf.title: PluginConfExternal Model

enabled.description: Whether the plugin instance is enabled.

modulePath.description: The module path of the plugin.

admin.description: If the user is an administrator.

pass.description: The user password. For login. Empty for using old password

User.description: The User holds information about permission and other stuff.
User.title: UserExternal Model

admin.description: If the user is an administrator.

UserPass.description: The Password for updating the user.
UserPass.title: UserExternalPass Model

buildDate.description: The date on which this binary was built.

commit.description: The git commit hash on which this binary was built.

appTokenAuthorizationHeader.description: Enter an application token with the `Bearer` prefix, e.g. `Bearer Axxxxxxxxxx`.
appTokenAuthorizationHeader.name: Authorization

clientTokenAuthorizationHeader.description: Enter a client token with the `Bearer` prefix, e.g. `Bearer Cxxxxxxxxxx`.
clientTokenAuthorizationHeader.name: Authorization
